It is characterized by its distinctive, large, and intricate fronds that resemble those of its more common relatives, such as the royal fern. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with a short, thick rhizome and compound leaves that are typically divided into multiple pinnae. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or wooded areas with rich, organic soil. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Nephrodium pittsfordense is considered a valuable subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
